messages.subject: low self esteem
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/16/02 1:44:42 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/16/02 1:44:42 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<<
I am the "she" that wrote the post about the pancakes!!.. It was all in one
post .. from beginning to end. Did you happen to read it? >>

Teresa, Yes, I read the post, but without going back and rereading every
single one I can not quote exact words can I?
If I had time to I would. But I have four children and a job to deal with.
I only remember that the first post Elissa responded to was saying that the
mother can't always respond when her child wants something.
That was questioned, which upset you. Then an example was given (the
pancake/coffee scenario) and most everyone agreed that you weren't ignoring
your childs need for your own. YAY!
Can we move on now? PLEEZ??

And this:
"TERESA IS A HATEFUL, VINDICITIVE PERSON WHO DOES NOT CARE
ABOUT HER CHILDRENS NEEDS . SHE IS ARROGANT AND DISTRUPTIVE"
was never implied NOR spoken. You are now accusing people of actually
attacking you, when they did not say any of the above things.
This is called reading into someones words things that are not there.
.

Ren
"Knowledge will not always take the place of simple observation."
~Arnold Lobel
Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
